Similar to Start Process by a form (PS: Maybe this was already threaten over forms for Tasks), when calling objectMapper.readValue(variable.getValue(), Object.class);, Jackson (the underlying library used by objectMapper) attempts to deserialize the JSON string in variable.getValue() into a Java object of type Object. The problem arises when the JSON string represents the literal string "null" rather than the JSON null value. In JSON, the value null is a special keyword indicating the absence of a value or a null value. It's not represented as a string, but as the literal null. For example: ``` { "someKey": null } ``` In contrast, if you have a string "null" in your JSON, it is treated as a regular string and not a null value: ``` { "someKey": "null" } ``` So, when you attempt to deserialize the string "null" into an Object using objectMapper.readValue(variable.getValue(), Object.class);, Jackson tries to parse it as a regular string, not as the special null value, resulting in the actual string "null" being returned. To handle this situation, I've added a check: ``` if (variable.getValue().equals("null")) { return "null"; // JSON Object null must be instanced like "null", also should not send to // objectMapper null values } ``` This check ensures that if the variable.getValue() is the string "null," you return the string "null" instead of trying to deserialize it using Jackson. This way, you're preserving the original intent of the "null" string in your JSON data. marcosgvieira: > So, when you attempt to deserialize the string "null" into an Object using objectMapper.readValue(variable.getValue(), Object.class);, Jackson tries to parse it as a regular string, not as the special null value, resulting in the actual string "null" being returned. So isn't it the same result as the new condition we are adding? nathansandi: > So isn't it the same result as the new condition we are adding? Yes, In such a case, you explicitly return the string "null" without attempting to deserialize it using objectMapper. The problem would be if go to Object mapper with the "null" value This code is handling both the case where the input is the string "null" and the case where it's a valid JSON string. The added condition ensures that you handle the special case of the string "null" without attempting unnecessary deserialization. The error was caused when goes to Object Mapper, trying to serialize the null json value marcosgvieira: > e the input is the string "null" and the case where it's a valid JSON string. The added condition ensures that you handle the special case of the string "null" without attempting unnecessary deserialization. The error was caused when goes to Object Mapper, trying to serialize the null json value Then if the result is the same I don't think we are fixing any error as the behavior is the same (also we are adding a condition to all the cases to try to avoid a deserialization in a case that doesn't happen so often) - should we really add this condition? The #3585 also cannot be closed by this PR as it's covered in another task by @houssain-barouni can you check if you referenced the right ticket? marcosgvieira: After a chat with @nathansandi he explained that when passing "null" to the objectMapper a NullPointer is throwed, so this is the reason for the condition. github-actions[bot]: Successfully created backport PR for `stable/8.3`: - #3810 github-actions[bot]: Successfully created backport PR for `stable/8.2`: - #3811
